Private Credit Impulse Signal

Private credit impulse: momentum in bank and consumer credit growth.

As of Unknown

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Private-Credit Impulse registered 0.185 for December 2025, remaining within the Stable credit regime (1).
  • This indicates steady credit growth, following a transition from a Decelerating regime observed earlier in the year (1).
  • Current readings are moderate, below the 0.75 threshold for acceleration (1).

Key Dynamics:

  • For December 2025, the signal (0.185) was solely driven by the robust-standardised total bank credit growth (Z_TOTBKCR_ann6 = 0.185).
  • In prior months, particularly October 2025, consumer loans (Z_TOTALSL_ann6 = -0.358) showed a negative contribution, offsetting positive bank and business loan growth.
  • The signal has gained momentum since March 2025, moving from decelerating levels (e.g., -0.762) into a consistent stable range.

Macro Relevance:

  • This signal informs the aggregate private-sector credit creation momentum, reflecting changes in liquidity and demand (1).
  • It functions as an early-to-mid-cycle indicator, with rapid credit creation often occurring early in economic expansions (1).
  • A stable impulse suggests credit conditions support trend GDP expansion, interacting with other demand-side macro signals (1).

Data & References:

  • TOTBKCR: Total Bank Credit, Level (2025-12-31)
  • BUSLOANS: Commercial & Industrial Loans, All Commercial Banks (2025-11-30)
  • TOTALSL: Total Consumer Loans Owned by Banks (2025-10-31)
  • The Z-score for total bank credit growth most influenced the latest signal due to incomplete component data.
  • Additional public datasets like GDP growth or survey-based credit conditions would enhance signal context and calibration.

References

  1. [Source: Private‑Credit Impulse — Methodology]

Self-Healing

  • Weaknesses in Provided Inputs:
    • `BUSLOANS` and `TOTALSL` data are missing for December 2025. This significantly impacts the composite nature of the `Private_Credit_Impulse` signal for the latest observation, as it defaults to a single component.

Maximum 6 bullets total. Only confirmed, material issues.
